website_summaries.verdict: The same great Mario Kart you know and love with some fantastic upgrades.
pros: This version includes improved graphics, new courses, new characters, and some clever new functions made to help out younger or less experienced players such as "smart steering."
The game also includes an online play mode and updated battle modes
cons: Online play can be a bit wonky at times

website_summaries.verdict: The huge number of characters and tracks, smooth controls, and fun items are fantastic, but Mario Kart 8 Deluxe really shines when you take on the world via its online racing modes.
pros: 42 racers, including Donkey Kong, Toad, and Bowser Jr. Race online against up to 12 players
Compatible with Nintendo Labo and Joy-Con Wheel
cons: While there are 48 racetracks, you’ll have to win the game’s various Cups to unlock them all

website_summaries.verdict: The best Mario Kart game ever gets even better on Switch, and its multiplayer modes make it great for groups.
pros: Tons of tracks and game modes
Includes everything from the top-notch Wii U game, plus more
Graphics look even better on Switch
cons: The tiny Joy-Con controllers get pretty cramped for multiplayer games
If you've already bought the Wii U game, this game isn't much different

customer_reviews.title: Destroying relationships has never been so much fun
customer_reviews.text: Do you have healthy relationships with your friends, family, and/or roommates? Do you want to ruin those relationships? Then this is the game for you! The number one most effective game for destroying civility is back and better than ever! Revel in triumph as you blast past those skilled gamers with your contemptuous bullet bill or blue shell items. Scream in unrequited rage as your perfect race is ruined by an errant green shell. Destroy lifelong relationships and burn bridges in under two minutes with the most entertaining and chaotic racing series devised by evil geniuses!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes Me Feel Like a Kid at Christmas!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really great gaming experience. Smooth as butter, great music, fun sound effects, very immersive. We've come a long way from Kart 64. I haven't really played much video games since the N64 (skipped both the Wii and WiiU, so I kinda feel like an old man jumping back into the World of Nintendo). It's made me feel like a kid again, and with how much stress I've been under these last few years with my health... that's a pretty big deal to me. Thank you, Nintendo. You guys are still making quality gaming experiences, and now I get to share it with my niece and nephews, which makes it 100x better. Take care. -Ken Jones, OKC, OK
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Dry Bowser w25 silver arrow sponge wheels glider = EZ mode
customer_reviews.text: Last time I played a Mario Kart was on SNES. This game is so fun with the Grand Prix, Battle mode, online, and co-op. I really enjoy the changes of 2 items, it offers alot of strategy. I especially enjoy the drift features and motion control. I started off with just doing the 50cc Grand Prix using the smart steering, no motion control, and not using drift at all. Now I've played so much that I'm on 200cc with only motion control, no smart steer, drifting like a King! Game is so fun and I really like the way it lets people jump into it from any point in their skill level.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: ... now in my thirties but this game is still like crack to me
customer_reviews.text: I am now in my thirties but this game is still like crack to me. I love it so much but I honestly had to stop playing it because I became addicted. I feel like the addition of 200cc makes this game even more addictive because it finally raises the difficulty level for all us that grew up with the game and always wanted more speed. Previously, my favorite Mario Kart was Double Dash. This game is just as good as that one. I would say they are tied. It would be better than Double Dash if only they would have brought back tilt-a-kart, which was the best battle map ever created. Cant have everything though.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Honeyfellow

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Fun Game, Great Game for Casual and Serious Gamers Alike
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if there's much more I can say about this game that hasn't been said before, but Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is an awesome game. The game is casual and simple enough for non gamers and young kids to pick up on, but complex enough for seasoned gamers to challenge themselves (and each other!) with. The graphics are beautiful, the new characters and karts whimsical, and the game is great for the family game night. Overall, great addition to our growing Nintendo Switch Library.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Digital Code does not work. Beware. NOT REGION FREE.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the code and gave it to a friend. The code does not work. I ask for help from Amazon and they send me to Nintendo. I call Nintendo and they said digital codes are not region free. The Switch is supposed to be regional free BUT IT IS NOT. No disclaimer anywhere. thanks a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel H.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best video game series ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I play this game a lot. Mario Kart is a great series to play when you just want to relax, and don't want to strain your brain with puzzles, or get frustrated with a really difficult game. Pros: Bright, colorful, cartoon like graphics. Lots of different tracks. Lots of characters to choose from. Customizable vehicles. Unlockable vehicles. Different kinds of vehicles. 4 different racing speeds. Single player, and online player. Cons: The only cons I can think of is that it doesn't have all the tracks from all the Mario Kart games, and it doesn't have the two person vehicles of Mario Kart: Double Dash. Overall this is one of the best games ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Mario kart 8 deluxe is, AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very, veeery fun game. If your looking for the most awsome multiplayer game ever, this is the one. The online can get very competative at times, buts the onlines pretty good, overall, the best online game too. Some people might say that super smash bros. Ultimate is the best online game, but it lags alot, mariokart 8 deluxe on the other hand runs very smoothely both in handheld mode, and playing online. Would very much reccomend this game.

customer_reviews.title: My kid loved it!

customer_reviews.title: the blue shell will most definitely ruin some friendship!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game if you want to ruin friendships, or even settle some debates on who's the better Mario Kart player! if you already on the Wii U version of Mario Kart 8 with the deluxe all you get are the unlock stages that you had to purchase on the Wii U version. The graphics are better the game play it's the same. I have no complaints personally I recommend this game for anybody who wants to have game night with a few friends or someone who likes competitive racing without the serious nature of Forza or any other realistic racing game. I also recommend for anybody who a love of Nintendo characters!

customer_reviews.title: Great game with lots of replay value for adults and kids
customer_reviews.text: Great multiplayer game for local or online play. This game has a lot of replay value and has quite a bit of single player content too. Don’t waste your time on the mobile Mariokart Tour game as it’s virtually unplayable unless you spend money, because of the horrible business model of mobile games and that’s thanks to mobile gamers refusing to spend money upfront. But anyway that’s a whole other issue. In my opinion, this is the best multiplayer game on the switch. It’s hard to make a game that can be enjoyed by people of all ages equally, but that’s exactly what Nintendo is so good at doing.

There's also too much going on with the colors and the map, I like the simpler stuff better. What a mighty fall from Mario kart Wii.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase

customer_reviews.title: Funnest installment yet!

I love that it's just with me wherever I go, and it's obviously the most family friendly game you can get! Don't understand why there aren't basic game options, like turning music off, but c'est la vie.
customer_reviews.author: The Atomic Outlander

customer_reviews.title: Wish there were more options...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it during the phone version release of this game, figured it might come with more maps to play besides the ones that this game already provides, was rather disappointed that there isn't much you can play. Liked that they have other options to play besides racing, like popping the balloons, and such. Maybe the online experience is much more different than the one you play locally. It certainly was what garnered the attention of my younger cousins that wouldn't stop playing it despite its repetitiveness. Still recommend it for the sake of playing with multiple players when you have friends or family members over.
customer_reviews.author: Tachinator

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: If you missed this on the Wii U, pick it up on the switch! Even if you picked it up on the Wii U two things make this a must buy: local lan multiplayer and a true battle mode. These two things make the repurchase a no brainer. Add in the ability to go mobile, and yeah. Every Sunday, we set up 4 Tv's and do 8 player local lan two people on a tv. So fun!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great Game, Easy to Pick Up!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played a Mario Kart game since the Wii version, which I was not a huge fan of. This version, however, has brought me back into the series. Mario Kart 8 has it all. Classic courses, a ton of drivers, and a lot of vehicle options. The gameplay is superb, and all of the different modes are fun. I play my nephew online frequently, and the multiplayer functionality is well integrated. There are multiple control options, so you can find the style that works for you the best. It is a great game for anybody to pick up and have fun with.
customer_reviews.author: Sean G

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for my Grand Kids, They play it all the time.

Now they can play there games while logged into the WIFI and talk to each other while playing the games. There are many games that I have bought for the Nintendo switch for my grandkids. They play them all the time. Sometimes I find them on the internet and play the games with them. Way to fast for me. I always loose.

customer_reviews.title: Classic Franchise.
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing the Mario Kart series since its release on SNES. Each installment has either brought us new content, or a new look at existing content. MK8 doesn't disappoint. The game holds true to its roots while introducing new racers and battle modes. I was pleased to see a variety of new tracks from various franchises within Nintendo. Though its a great game, its nothing groundbreaking. Just another installment of the same game with slight modifications. Still, a must have for any Switch owner.

customer_reviews.title: Great Game - Didn't receive USA version
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the game and I think the series is a must-have for pretty much every Nintendo system. I only wish it weren't just a Wii U port but oh well. The game itself is perfect so my issue has no reason to deduct stars from it's rating. The seller "OTL" sent me a EUR region game when I was expecting a USA version and that is a little annoying. customer_reviews.title: Racing fun for everyone!!

customer_reviews.author: Kelvin Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy if you've never owned a Wii U.  Grown Man Child approved.
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome. I've only played 6 or 7 circuits of the 50cc race category but I'm already addicted. Graphics are gorgeous and the framerate is a smooth 60 fps at all times. The fluidity is almost jarring. If you missed out on the Wii U generation like me, this is a no-brainer "must buy" just like Breath of the Wild. See you online. Dibs on Yoshi. .

customer_reviews.title: Best Mario Kart yet!
customer_reviews.text: By far, the best Mario Kart, yet! - and I've been playing since SNES. I love the homage made to the tracks of Mario Karts past, and even F-Zero. Controls are easy to pick up, and what I couldn't figure out naturally is documented in-game. I find it funny that Switch games don't seem to come with manuals, in spite of there being a place for them in the jewel cases.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pure Karting Madness!
customer_reviews.text: The madness is real! I love this game! It has provided me and my family with hours of entertainment. It is kid friendly, yet entertaining enough to challenge adults too. I love the remakes of some of the old tracks. There are tons of cart configuration options too. Definitely worth the buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: jmace5150

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic collection of the original & all the DLC from ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic collection of the original & all the DLC from the WiiU version. Multiplayer with the Joy-Cons is great and makes multiplayer quick anytime, anyplace. Online & local wireless multiplayer round out the package nicely. Unlockable cars, upgrades and parts add longevity and a reason to play single player. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: T. Regulski

customer_reviews.title: Software glitch but game is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars only because of a glitch that causes one remote (a different one, depending on which you use to start the game) to ALWAYS lose its ability to use the tilt control steering. It's a software glitch and happened after we updated the game's software. Very, very disappointing. BUT, it is the most awesome and fun game I have ever played. The graphics are out of this world. From ages 5 to 43, our whole family loves this game.

customer_reviews.title: Fun

It's pretty much like the games in the past but this time, there's wheels, cars, and gliders that you unlock in the game w/ coins that you collect when you're racing. There's also some characters from Splatoon, Legend of Zelda, and Animal Crossing and you can be a Mii that you created on the console which I thought was neat. I hope you can also unlock different characters too. I've only gotten to 150 cc and completed 50 cc and 100 cc so I'm not sure if you do.
customer_reviews.author: Weaboobs

customer_reviews.title: This is one Switch game that is actually worth $60
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game, best of all you can play with real people, in the same room, together. It's this retro concept of playing video games with real friends and family on the same TV. You can play with 3 other people, and they are not online, yes they are real. With this game, you will not have to buy multiple copies of the same game and multiple consoles to play with real people. There is a large amount of content; tracks, carts, wheels and characters.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good game for when you have company or kids over
customer_reviews.text: Got this game for my wife, she has always been a huge fan of Mario Kart, and she wanted to be able to play against my nephew because he has it also. She has played it all the way through and we play together from time to time. Replay value isn’t super high, but... it’s an excellent game if you have company or kids over because everyone can get into it and it’s a lot of fun. Amazon had it for a decent price, shipping was fast as usual, and it came as described.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, what can I say that hasn't already been said about this game? This game is tons of fun for everyone. I purchased it as a Christmas present for my daughter, but I've probably played it more than she has. Brings back a lot of memories when I used to play the original Mario Kart on Super Nintendo and N64--just much better graphics. If you're looking for a fun game to play by yourself, with friends, or with family, I highly recommend this game. The great thing is that you can play Mario Kart online against other people now.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: This is a great game! its a ton of fun to play ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game! its a ton of fun to play and made some nice improvements from the previous wii U version. you start off with all of the characters and difficulties unlocked but you have to earn the different cars, wheels and gliders by getting coins in each race. Each character has a unique place style with different weights, handling and traction, meaning that every character you play as, you need to change how you play it. The only issue with this game that I have is that too much is given to you in the beginning of the game and I wish I had to unlock the different characters like in previous games
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Luster

customer_reviews.title: The next generation of Mario Kart holds no punches!
customer_reviews.text: ZOOM ZOOM! This classic has now been updated for the Nintendo Switch. I paired my purchase with the Amazon Basics Steering Wheels, where you pop in your switch controllers (joy cons— I suppose because they *spark joy*?) and use those for the game. Those truly step up your driving experience. I’m an old school GameCube fan, so I’m thrilled to have a new Mario Kart worth sinking my teeth into.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: MK8D is the same great Mario Kart, but looking better than ever
customer_reviews.text: This game is great! As a huge childhood Nintendo fan that has lost touch with them since the Gamecube, the visuals and new stuff added to MK8Deluxe is incredible. The old maps are redone so well, but kept the "charm" (looking at you Rainbow Road!) of the original maps I remember. Played this game with a friend and I haven't had that much fun playing multiplayer in years. Also nice to know I kept my green shell sniping skills all these years. I'll skip out on Overwatch to get blue shelled into 8th place any day.
customer_reviews.author: ThaWulf

customer_reviews.title: Best Mario Kart game so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have played nearly every Mario Kart from the classic 64 to the dark days of Double Dash. This is by far my favorite. I feel like it combines all the best features from all of the previous Mario Karts as well as the maps. The switch is definitely the best console to play it on, and it makes multiplayer very easy. Would highly recommend this game if you have friends over, or even small dinner parties it is always a blast.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brough

customer_reviews.title: Great classic game with Awesome updates!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, who doesn't love mario cart. Ever since SNES I have loved this game. I like that it incorporates tracks from previous versions of the game. I especially LOVE the auto driving and steering features (you can disable these as well) so my 5 year old can play along without taking 26 minutes to finish a round... Sometimes she even places high in the rankings. This is a HUGE plus so thank you Nintendo. Lastly, this works great on the switch and I love that you can play so many different ways (I.e. consule screen, tv screen, multiplayer, motion controlled or regular button control). Really satisfied with this purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Go on n git it!
customer_reviews.text: Why are you reading this? It’s obviously a slam dunk...

customer_reviews.title: This is such an awesome game & makes for a wonderful addition to the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome game & makes for a wonderful addition to the Mario Kart family. The gameplay, graphics, sounds, characters & tracks are incredible. You'll find yourself drawn into it very quickly & when you play along with your friends, it's that much better. This game takes what made the prior versions so good & makes them that much better. I highly recommend getting this game for your Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Cyb3rPh0bia

customer_reviews.title: One of the best multiplayer games of all time
customer_reviews.text: After playing every Mario Kart since the N64, I have to say that this game still stands as one of the best multiplayer game I have ever played without the angry rages people get from other games like shooters and the like. Personally, my only disappointment is that everything seems to be unlocked (minus cart customizations). Overall, Mario Kart never gets old and the Switch only makes it more fun to play with friends and family.

customer_reviews.title: Automatic Purchase if your a Nintendo Switch owner.

This game is really fun and easy to play with once you get it figured out. You could spend hours playing and maybe not see all the chances to create something new.... everyone in the Mario universe is here plus a ton of others represented. Such a cool game!

customer_reviews.title: Great game! May ship different region copy.
customer_reviews.text: The game is amazing, one if he beats mario Kart entries since the original. Be advised however, Amazon may send you a different Region copy of the game like they did for me. I am currently residing in the United States but they sent me the United Kingdom version instead. The game still works, the box art is different however. Did not ruin the experience of the game, just a little bummed I don't have the U.S. case like all my other Switch games.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Scotten

customer_reviews.title: Only great for die hard battle mode fans.
customer_reviews.text: The game runs at a consistent 60 fps and looks beautiful. However Mario Kart 8 Deluxe doesn't offer anything new other than the 2 Splatoon characters, a couple of new karts and some new battle arenas and a 2 new battle modes being renegade mode and a capture the flag type of mode. Everything else just returning features, characters and abilities from older Mario Kart games. All in all unless if you're a die hard fan of battle mode such as myself or you don't already have a Wii U then there's no point in buying Mario Kart 8 twice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for anyone with a Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe offers the best things you've come to expect from Mario Kart on the TV at home, but also in a portable format. Comes standard with all of the DLC released for the original Mario Kart 8 on the Wii U, but also includes a brand new Battle Mode, a real, proper battle mode with several modes on dedicated maps. One of the best games for the Switch right now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Nintendo switch.
customer_reviews.text: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe has really delivered with gamer's. With characters from across several different Nintendo properties race through fantastical Nintendo-themed tracks. Bestow power ups and weapons to help even the odds. I’ve had no problems connecting to a race, online.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Alvarisi

customer_reviews.title: Endless Fun
customer_reviews.text: The fast paced kart racing game is back on the Switch! When you boot up the game, it has every character unlocked, as well as all of the maps, but not the customization of each of the cars. It's endless fun with your friends on splitscreen, or online with people who also have a Switch. It's endless entertainment, and worth buying a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Gurney

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game.
customer_reviews.text: A super-fun game that my buddies and I ALWAYS wind up going back to, even after we've cleared all the cups. We still have an absolute blast playing this. A must-have game if you're taking your Switch to your friend's place or just about anywhere really. The game arrived in good condition, box wasn't beat up or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: A great Mario Kart game, especially for two players
customer_reviews.text: At this point, the Mario Kart experience is something that most gamers are familiar with. The game is a ton of fun, requires a surprising amount of skill to succeed consistently, and packs a number of online features that are beyond the norm for Nintendo's library of games. The only thing I wish was different is the framerate for when more than two players are racing on split-screen; this is a game that is simply more fun in 60 fps, and it is capped at 30fps with three or more players. The hardware limitations are understandable, but I have a feeling that many players would have rather seen Nintendo explore a cut in resolution or graphics quality before cutting frames.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't expect a new game.
customer_reviews.text: don't expect a new game. this is exactly like mk8 on the wii u. however, you don't have to unlock most items anymore. i'm a big fan since i mostly like to play online. it's great cause i don't play on my wii u anymore. i play mostly on the switch.

customer_reviews.text: Will never be as good as Mario kart Wii but it’s fun to play. I highly disagree with their decision to make the sides of tracks push you back towards the course. It gets rid of the skill aspect. If you drive off the course you should be punished for driving off the course. Not handicapped back on the course. But it’s still fun nevertheless

customer_reviews.title: If you like Nintendo, you're going to love this!
customer_reviews.text: One of my specialties is playing Mario Kart. I've been playing most of my life, and this game already looked good even though I originally had it on the Wii U. It is still worth it, but that is what I think. Others might not. If you like, or even love Nintendo products, this is the game for you. If you're just now trying out games, still is a pretty good pick to buy. If you do not like the racing and competitive genres of games, then maybe do not buy this. Overall, multiplayer is fun, online is fun, and I have been playin since I got it!

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun for our family!
customer_reviews.text: Our family is absolutely in love with this game. The steering assist has for the first time made a racing game like this accessible to my 3 year old, who has been having a blast with our 5 1/2 year old, my wife, and me in four player races and battles. Single player is great as well, but multiplayer on this game is probably better than any game I've ever seen. Well done Nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great fun replayable game but close all your windows and doors.
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Tons of replay ability. The only problem is that you will spend most of your time cussing at your television because the computer are just awful. They abuse you through out the game and you just have to take it. I haven’t cussed so much in recently memory. I’ve had my neighbors come to me asking if I was okay. They heard me scream one night “ you cheating bastard, I hope you burn in hell”. Normally my wife is shouting that at me, not me at the TV. So they had cause for concern.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Heng

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: Tried this as a first game to introduce my son to Nintendo Switch and video games in general. Picked this one as it’s racing, he gets to pick his favorite character and we get to play together when we are stuck at home for fun momma/ son bonding time. It will take a little while to master as he is very young but we are having a blast playing it. You can’t go wrong with Mario Kart. Great game!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime McCutcheon

customer_reviews.title: What is Mario Kart and is it fun?
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the folks that are unfamiliar with this product. The game is a non-realistic arcade racing game aimed at all ages. You can play in various modes against local split screen players, alone or online. The game has a great feature for inexperienced players that keeps them in the pack no matter how poorly you play. My 5 year old, his mom and I all play this game and it is a blast. You don't need to play online or even with others in order to enjoy. It's just a joyful game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4-year old son. I was surprised at how easily he was able to play it. The graphics, characters and play experience are very good. I would have given 5 stars, but the game seems repetitive; you have different maps that make the game look different, but in the end, that's all there is, a different map for another race. I would recommend it for your kids though.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Mario Kart yet
customer_reviews.text: Having skipped the Wii U, I hadn't played Mario Kart since the version on the Wii. I got this the day it released and have been having a blast since. This is the best version yet. It's great having all of the characters and tracks unlocked from the outset. The item distribution remains infuriating especially if you're leading the race, but that's part of the Mario Kart charm, I suppose. The AI difficulty really ramps up at 150-200cc, and totally amplifies item rage when you're inevitably targeted by blue or red shells in the last lap of a race. Additionally, online play has been fun, but not without occasional connectivity issues. Although those have largely improved since launch.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: We play this game as a family (4 player) and love it. It is super fun, with a lot of colorful race courses. The best part is that you can unlock secret racing suits using amiibos from other games. We had the Samus and Link suits. My daughter is working to save up for the Mega Man suit.... great motivator tool. We recently had 18 kids over for a birthday party. The kids (boys and girls alike) loved this game, and were equally excited to play and watch others play this game.
customer_reviews.author: Will Phan

customer_reviews.title: This is a must-have for the Switch
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Switch, get this game. It just works in every way for the console. The single player experience is fun, and the multiplayer experience can be hectic on such a small screen, but still fun. As a bonus, this game has one of the most comfortable uses of a sideways Joy-Con! One of the better Mario Kart games I've played.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Game Made Better by the Switch!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game in the franchise! You start with all the characters and modes from the Get-Go, which is great to dive right in with friends. Race to collect coins to unlock more vehicle customization options. Includes all DLC from Mario Kart 8 WiiU Great cast of characters. All modes are unlocked from the beginning Great Racing Levels with a bunch of awesome classic levels Controls are nice and smooth Graphics and Audio are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Pants

customer_reviews.title: 1st game to get on switch, wise decesion
customer_reviews.text: its a blast for family time but also I miss having to win the CC racing speeds and cups. in the past you would have to beat levels in order to get new tracks but now you collect coins to get car customizations which is still pretty nice but eh. also grand prix can be played with more than 2 people now so thats a good upside. also the battles have larger battles fields and makes me miss the sudden death balloon battles I would have as a kid on the gamecube double dash gamecube battle field. any ways you can never go wrong with playing mario kart with the family
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and Better!
customer_reviews.text: On the switch this game is so much better then on the Wiiu. I loved this game when it came out on Wiiu, it felt lacking though. Here, it feels like I bought the full game and already have got so much out of it. Great party game and so much fun on the go. A must buy if you like racing games!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the unlocked all the courses from the start as that was part of the fun but from the minimal amount I've played so far it's the expected fun and the Switch just feels better than the WiiU did. Amazon did have a shipping issue but I did find that they corresponded with me to let me know of the situation. Not thrilled about the delay but at least the let me know and apologized for it. Took 1 star away for the delay and the fact that they have most of the game unlocked from the start.
customer_reviews.author: XJS007

customer_reviews.title: Got an empty case
customer_reviews.text: Edit: so I had spoken with amazon about the empty case received and they had not wasted any time in sending me a replacement. Glad that my brothers got to play mario kart together. So I buy two copies for both of my brothers birthday party. And turns out the day of the party I notice that I got an empty case. This is beyond unacceptable. I am highly dissapointed. They each have a switch light so cant even play together now like I anticipated they could.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Is it worth a repurchase?
customer_reviews.text: If you have the Wii U version and are on the edge about repurchasing, I'll give you my two cents. First off the mobile application should speak for itself. Also the game does look remastered very well with a lot higher contrasts and great colors. All the characters are unlocked and all DLC from Wii U is included. I wasn't really digging buying it until I played it for around 30 mins. It sold me on why the switch is going to be a great console. Great graphics and great game. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Thisisacomputernerd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect outside of Online Play
customer_reviews.text: Its mario kart and its as perfect as ever for game nights with friends. The mechanics and mayhem is great and with so many characters/courses/items theres plenty to mess around with. My only complaint is that they didnt update the netcode from the Wii-U release, connecting to lobbies online can often take 1-3 tries to get a stable connection. Its 2017, I shouldnt get dropped from online lobbies nearly everytime i try to play online.
customer_reviews.author: Zergonomics

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, if you have a Nintendo Switch, you need Mario Cart. It is a good game for casual gamers. It is easy to play with friends, though you may not be friends after— it gets competitive fast. Any skill level can play this game. Little kids can even play. And this is a great game to play kids versus parents.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Jane

customer_reviews.title: FUNNEST GAME WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY
customer_reviews.text: Once I bought this my friends and I couldn't stop playing it! The physical game itself arrived in good condition and it's legit. Now on to actual game, it's such an upgrade from the WII mario kart which was the only one I knew LOL. There's so much more different circuits, car options, and 200cc option, characters to choose, and the HD quality is just AMAZING. Well done nintendo. One of my fav games to keep going back to!
customer_reviews.author: Leirartist

customer_reviews.title: Great game for Mario Kart fans.
customer_reviews.text: Huge step up from the Mario Kart franchise. Has a wide selection of character and kart customizations, new 200cc engine mode, and 5 different battle modes with custom arena maps. Any fan of the Mario Kart franchise will love this game as well as newcomers and even younger kids due to an easy driving setting that could be turned on to prevent them from bumping into walls too frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob DuBois

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game!
customer_reviews.text: I never owned this for Wii U but it was one of my first purchases for the Switch. It's my second most played game after Zelda BotW. It's a ton of fun whether you play it online or just single player. One of two games my wife enjoys playing with me (Puyo Puyo Tetris is the other).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Trout

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. Even my 5 year old likes it. I do recommend getting a controller holder though, its a bit difficult when handheld.
customer_reviews.author: D. Music

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun, I enjoy playing it, but I think I enjoyed MK 7 more. This one does too much hand-holding. It doesn't allow me to fall off the map, and, overall, it seems to be fairly easy compared to version MK 7. I still recommend it. It's fun to play online and I like collecting coins to unlock the various karts. I just feel like the maps were more fun on MK 7. I miss some of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: How can it get better than this?
customer_reviews.text: The biggest thing I like about Mario Kart is the courses. Back when Mario Kart 8's downloadable content came out, I thought it was the best Mario Kart ever. I expected it not to hold that spot once the Switch came out, due to its lack of proper battle courses. And MAN was I right. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe marked the return of the actual battle mode and a few Switch exclusive content. I just can't imagine how good Mario Kart 9 will be after this masterpiece
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Another Really Fun Nintendo Switch Game!
customer_reviews.text: A while ago I purchased this game, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe - Nintendo Switch (by Nintendo).. and I have to say that it is a lot of fun! The graphics are great, the gameplay is smooth, and the overall experience is very enjoyable! This game also allows you to play online.. against other players. And of course you can play single player as well if you like. I would very likely recommend this title to almost anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch!

customer_reviews.title: It's a Mario Kart!

customer_reviews.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a perfect port from the Wii U I love all of ...

When we’d play on the Wii, he’d always quit because he’d get turned around or keep falling off. This allows us to all play together and it’s built up his confidence and skill!!

customer_reviews.title: Mario Kart: The Good and The Bad.
customer_reviews.text: Those familiar with Mario Kart I would say this is the most accessible version of the game/series. There's modes that younger children can play and win, which I'm sure increasing the fun for most. The other modes such as 150cc is classic Mario Kart. You will wonder how your opponent manages to stay right behind you the entire race no matter how many times you take him out. Meanwhile you need to run an almost flawless race along with using mini booster every turn if you want first place. Of course the true strength of Mario Kart for those that don't know is the multiplayer.

product_meta.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description:
Hardware Platform:Nintendo Switch| Edition:Standard| Media format:Physical

Hit the road with the definitive version of Mario Kart 8 and play anytime, any-where! Race your friends or battle them in a revised battle mode on new and returning battle courses. Play locally in up to 4-player multiplayer in 1080p while playing in TV Mode. Every track from the Wii U version, including DLC, makes a glorious return. Plus, the Inklings appear as all-new guest characters, along with returning favorites, such as King Boo, Dry Bones, and Bowser Jr.!

If you don’t already have a Nintendo Switch Online membership, you can try it out with a free 7-day trial. Don't worry if you already activated a previous free trial— an additional seven-day free trial is now available.

Nintendo Switch Online membership and Nintendo Account required for online features. Free trial automatically converts to 1-month auto-renewing membership unless automatic renewal is turned off by the end of the free trial. Credit card/PayPal account required for 18+. Free trial cannot be redeemed by a Nintendo Account with an active Individual Membership or Family Membership. Not available in all countries. Internet access required for online features. Terms apply.

System Requirements: Supported Platforms: Nintendo - Switch
Nintendo account required for game activation and installation

Nintendo Switch Online membership (sold separately) and Nintendo Account required for online play. Not available in all countries. Internet access required for online features. Terms apply.
